articles.author: By The Associated Press
articles.title: The Latest: Microsoft uncovers more Russian attacks
articles.description: The Latest on efforts by Russia to disrupt midterm elections in the U.S. using fake internet domains (all times local):

articles.title: Indiana SOS launches campaign to boost voter confidence
articles.description: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Indiana Secretary of State Connie Lawson is launching a campaign to boost confidence in the integrity of elections.

articles.title: Rhode Island uses $3M in federal funds for election security
articles.description: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) — Rhode Island is spending $3 million in federal funds to secure and modernize its elections systems.

articles.author: By KIMBERLEE KRUESI Associated Press
articles.title: Idaho gets $3.2M in grant money for election security
articles.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — Idaho is receiving $3.2 million from the U.S. Election Assistance Commission to secure and modernize its elections systems.

articles.title: Election board affirms policy against posting write-in list
articles.description: FRAKNFORT, Ky. (AP) — The Kentucky State Board of Elections has voted to reaffirm its policy of not posting lists of write-in candidates in polling places.

articles.title: Rural Idaho counties have more active voters than urban ones
articles.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — Recent data shows more Idaho voters are turning out for statewide elections than ever before, but many Idaho counties lag behind the U.S. average, which the Pew Research Center puts at about 56 percent.

articles.author: By BRINLEY HINEMAN and KATE BRUMBACK Associated Press
articles.title: Plan to close polling places in black county draws backlash
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — A predominantly black county in rural Georgia is facing a nationwide backlash over plans to close about 75 percent of its voting locations ahead of the November election.

articles.title: Trump returning to campaign in West Virginia
articles.description: CHARLESTON, W.Va. (AP) — President Donald Trump is making his sixth visit to West Virginia since taking office.

articles.title: Federal officials to Florida: No signs of Russian meddling
articles.description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) — Federal authorities are telling Florida election officials they have not seen any "new or ongoing compromises" of state and local election systems.

articles.title: The Latest: Cardi B is pre-show winner at MTV VMAs
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The Latest on the MTV Video Music Awards (all times local):

articles.title: Missouri's McCaskill to meet with US Supreme Court nominee
articles.description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. (AP) — Missouri Sen. Claire McCaskill is slated to meet with President Donald Trump's U.S. Supreme Court nominee.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Recent Kansas editorials
articles.description: The Lawrence Journal-World, Aug. 20

articles.author: By DUSTIN WEAVER and LISA MASCARO Associated Press
articles.title: Sen. Collins, potential swing vote, to meet with Kavanaugh
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh is set to meet with Republican Sen. Susan Collins of Maine, a centrist who's seen as a potential swing vote on his confirmation.

articles.author: By The Associated Press
articles.title: Recent editorials from Texas newspapers
articles.description: Here are selections from recent editorials in Texas newspapers:

articles.author: By KEN SWEET and TOM KRISHER AP Business Writers
articles.title: Experts say Tesla board may have too many ties to CEO Musk
articles.description: For years, Tesla's board remained almost invisible, staying behind the curtain as superstar Chairman and CEO Elon Musk guided the electric car maker to huge stock price increases. Now, given Musk's recent questionable behavior, experts say it's time for the…

articles.title: Experts say Tesla board may have too many ties to CEO Musk

articles.author: CBS Radio News
articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 08/21
articles.description: Colorado man charged with murdering his wife and daughter claims his wife killed the girls. New allegations of Russian hacking ahead of the midterm elections. University of North Carolina students topple confederate statue.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Donald Trump’s America
articles.description:
Monmouth University polling finds that only 35% of Americans think  the country is on the right track and only 30% believe Trump hires the best people. 
Morning Joe breaks down the numbers and what it means for the midterm elections.

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: Watch: Trump Refocuses Midterm Elections on Immigration, ‘Blue Wave Means Crime, Open Borders’
articles.description: President Trump is refocusing the midterm elections on the issue of immigration, saying in a White House speech on Monday that a "blue wave" in November "means crime" and "open borders."

articles.author: Robert Kraychik
articles.title: Avenatti’s Michelle Obama Remix: ‘When They Go Low, We Hit Harder’
articles.description: Michael Avenatti advised Democrats to "fight fire with fire" in forthcoming elections during a Monday speech at a Democrat fundraiser in Hillsborough County, NH. He described himself as "fighting on behalf of every American that believes in facts, evidence, a…
